gamemodels.Board module¶

class gamemodels.Board.Board¶

Bases: object

Everything that stands on the board, so the tiles, corner-pieces and edge-pieces.

add_token_to_tile(number, tile_location) → None¶
all_placeable_corner_spots() → list¶

Returns all the corner-coordinates that are placeable. AKA it lays adjacent to a land tile.

all_placeable_edge_spots() → list¶

Returns all the edge-coordinates that are placeable. AKA it lays adjacent to a land tile.

calculate_pips() → None¶

Calculate the probability-points in advance so it doesn’t need to be done each time it’s requested.

get_corner_piece(location) → gamemodels.BoardPieces.CornerPiece¶
get_edge_piece(location: numpy.ndarray) → gamemodels.BoardPieces.EdgePiece¶
get_harbor(corner_location: numpy.ndarray) → str¶
get_settlements_of_player(player_id: int) → dict¶

Returns a dictionary with all the locations and settlements of a certain player.

get_token(number) → gamemodels.Tiles.Token¶
static hashable_location(location: numpy.ndarray) → tuple¶

Converts a numpy-array location to a hashable form so it can be used in dictionaries and sets.

load_layout(filename) → None¶

Load a layout (tiles and tokens) from a certain file.

save_layout(filename) → None¶

Save the layout (tiles and tokens) to a certain file.

surround_with_water() → None¶

Makes sure that every land-tile is surrounded by other tiles. By surrounding them all with water.

surrounding_corners_free(corner_location) → bool¶

A check for looking if there is enough space around the spot.

valid_edge(edge_location) → bool¶

This edge-location isn’t fully on water.

gamemodels.Board.example_board() → gamemodels.Board.Board¶

Returns a board with the example layout from the Settlers of Catan rule book

class gamemodels.BoardPieces.CornerPiece(player_id)¶

Bases: gamemodels.BoardPieces.BoardPiece

All the board-pieces that stand on the corner-coordinate-system, AKA the spots in the three-way intersections.

classmethod display_coordinate(corner_location) → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns the location in the display-coordinate-system. The function is just: x-y, x+y

classmethod location_type(corner_location) → int¶

A corner-coordinate can be on the top of a tile, the bottom of a tile, or inside (which should never be the case obviously). Outcomes of this function mean: 0:Top, 1:Bottom or 2:Inside

classmethod surrounding_edge_coordinates(corner_location) → list¶

Returns the coordinates of the three edges surrounding this corner location.

class gamemodels.BoardPieces.EdgePiece(player_id)¶

Bases: gamemodels.BoardPieces.BoardPiece

All the board-pieces that stand on the edge-coordinate-system, AKA the lines between two tiles.

classmethod connected_corner_coordinates(edge_location) → list¶

The corner-locations this edge-location is connected to.

classmethod other_corner_location(edge_location, reference_corner_location) → numpy.ndarray¶

When you have the edge-location and one corner-location the other corner-location can be faster calculated this way. The relation is really interesting: corner_location_a + corner_location_b = edge_location

Returns a list of all the valid actions the player whose turn it is can make.

The number of victory points a certain player has.

winners() → list¶

A list of players that have enough victory points. Nobody means the game isn’t done yet and the list is empty
